comments.body: I'm not tied to it but I find the error reporting and naming here somewhat confusing as it doesn't really distinguish position from labels. Is there a logical way to make that distinction here and obviously in the implementation?

I agree, but the purpose of the commit is to provide error reporting consistent with the error raised when the size of _usecols_ is different from the width of the dataframe. 

Distinguishing between reporting mechanisms for labels and indices seems like a new commit.

diffHunk:

    mssg = _msg_validate_usecols_names.format(missing)
    with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=mssg):
        parser.read_csv(StringIO(data), usecols=usecols, names=names)
